channel.title: Content from Larry Reisman
channel.description: An RSS feed that delivers you piping hot content from journalist Larry Reisman.

item.title: Law needed to fight COVID-19 battle with masks?
item.description: “Unfortunately masks have been a divisive issue,” Brown told an Indian River County Chamber of Commerce Zoom gathering. “That’s really unfortunate.”

item.title: Are there two favorites in IRSC president search?
item.description: Frank Brogan, former Florida Atlantic University president, and Christina Hart, Indian River State College's second in command, seem like favorites.

item.title: Opinion: Video shows courage, training of sheriff's deputy
item.description: Indian River County Sheriff Deryl Loar released dash camera video of a deputy’s pursuit of a carjacking suspect and the shootout that ensued.

item.title: Opinion: Video shows courage, training of sheriff's deputy
item.description: Indian River County Sheriff Deryl Loar released dash camera video of a deputy’s pursuit of a carjacking suspect and the shootout that ensued.

item.title: Indian River County Sheriff's office offers update on shooting at Walmart in Vero Beach
item.description: Maj, Eric Flowers says deputies have shot and killed the suspect.

item.title: IRSCO describes chain of events at Walmart in Vero Beach
item.description: IRSCO describes chain of events at Walmart in Vero Beach

item.title: IRSCO deputies escort shoppers back to their cars at Walmart
item.description: Indian River County Sheriff's deputies escorting Walmart shoppers in Vero Beach ⁦ to their cars about 90 minutes after the shooting.

item.title: Accused carjacker killed in shootout with deputy
item.description: Indian River County Sheriff's Office is investigating a carjacking where at least two people were shot outside Walmart

item.title: Add courtesy, respect to how we treat others
item.description: Whether or not we believe in the Bible or a higher being, can we all review some of the verbiage in Leviticus regarding what we call the Golden Rule?

item.title: Daily record shows COVID-19 still a concern
item.description: Indian River County administrator, health official urge continued caution amid COVID-19 re-openings. No room to return to old habits, they say.

item.title: Mural defaced, but artists OK with BLM changes
item.description: “Most people don’t bother to learn the back story,” George Colon said of his "All Lives Matter" mural. He supported a change to "Black Lives Matter."

item.title: Downtown Vero Beach mural becomes memorial
item.description: “Most people don’t bother to learn the back story,” artist George Colon said of critics of the original mural. “They just have their own perceptions.

item.title: Take a look at the George Floyd demonstrations on the Treasure Coast
item.description: Sights and sounds of the Justice for George Floyd demonstrations on the Treasure Coast

item.title: Protesters gather in Gifford
item.description: Crowd gathers in Gifford to protest the death of George Floyd on May 31, 2020.

item.title: Sheriffs: Press should have access to riot scene
item.description: It shouldn’t take the president of your company calling Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz to get you out. His State Patrol didn't know how to deal with CNN.

item.title: New Florida State League prez waits for 1st game
item.description: Terry Reynolds, the general manager of the Vero Beach Dodgers in the early 1980s, was elected to the Florida State League Hall of Fame in 2010.

item.title: Respect needed at Sebastian council meetings
item.description: Thursday’s meeting was dominated by 34 speakers, including many members of a recall group who blasted Damien Gilliams, Pam Parris and Charles Mauti

item.title: I-95 exit could spur more talk of new 'town'
item.description: Richard Baker, president of Pelican Island Audubon Society, sent a letter of concern to Indian River County commissioners about the St. Johns idea.

item.title: Visuals from St. Johns Improvement District
item.description: The St, Johns Improvement District is responsible for 25,071.69 acres from State Road 60 to the St. Lucie County line and west of Interstate 95.

item.title: Sheriff's race could bring Dems, indies to GOP
item.description: With next Indian River County sheriff likely to come from the four-man Republican primary, Democrats and independents could make a temporary change.
